intro: Pachypodium horombense, commonly known as the Horombé pachypodium, is a succulent plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems that store water, allowing it to survive in arid environments. The plant has sparse, spiny leaves and produces yellow or white flowers during the dry season. Its unique morphology makes it well adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. It is often found in rocky soils and is a striking example of xerophytic adaptation.
